About Atrium:

Atrium is a full-service talent management firm, focused on providing contingent workforce solutions. Atrium expertise includes Temporary and Direct Hire Staffing, Payrolling Services, Independent Contractor Compliance, Managed Service Provider (MSP) Programs and Intern Program Management.

Position Overview:

Atrium partners with a global pharmaceutical client located in the Boston Seaport District to provide managed solutions that support contingent, full time and early talent hiring. We’re looking for a passionate and motivated Early Talent Program Manager to Strategically lead early talent hiring with a heightened focus on creating meaningful university partnerships and diversity hiring.

Responsibilities:

  • The Early Talent Program Manager will create and execute a recruiting strategy that supports evolving business needs, which results in a top-tier, qualified talent pool of early talent  
  • Partner with universities and varied organizations that can produce a diverse, high quality candidate slate and talent pipeline
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will design and deploy communications to educate about the value of early talent hiring in a cadence that keeps internal stakeholders informed, engaged and accountable
  • Seek out opportunities to stay engaged and abreast of STEM recruitment best practices, internally and externally
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will partner with HR Business Partners to gain a thorough understanding of business and functional needs and provide ongoing support
  • Act as a champion for early career talent by appropriately and continuously communicating successes and wins throughout the organization to enhance credibility and reputation
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will work with flagship program managers in the business to develop recruitment strategies to identify top candidates at target schools and partner organizations
  • Develop strong, cross-functional Atrium and client relationships; maintain communication with leadership, sponsors (TA/HR), managers and candidates
  • Conduct thorough intake calls with managers to ascertain specific soft skills and additional preferences to ensure appropriate resumes are screened and presented
  • The Early Talent Program Manager will operate within client ATS and match qualified applicants against requisitions
  • Model the highest levels of integrity and deliver concierge service to support client and applicants

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, Science or related field of study
  • 3-5 years of Talent Acquisition experience within the Early Career recruitment space
  • Proven experience in assessing talent and discerning exceptional talent from strong talent; ability to maintain high bar for top caliber talent 
  • Demonstrated track record working on and closing multiple open recruiting assignments
  • Track record for assessing and building recruiting strategies around talent diversity from a racial or ethnic minority
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with the internal Client and Atrium program team
  • Advanced computer skills including proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.) and HRIS systems
  • Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, organizational, social and motivational skills
  • Ability to excel working in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven ability cultivating successful relationships internally and externally

The post Remote Early Talent Program Manager appeared first on Atrium.

Job Summary

The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions. Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience.

Job Responsibilities

•Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand. •Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications. •Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques. •Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware. •Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect. •Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements. •Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area. •Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment. •Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results. •Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:
•Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience. •Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience. •Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise. •Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services. •Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as • Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift •Operating Systems: Windows, Linux •Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB • Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio) •Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android) •Alexa skill development •MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access •Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively. •Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary. •Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly. •Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills. •Ability to learn new business and technical concepts. •Good written and oral communication skills.

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

As a Technology Professional this role is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills and launch an exciting career in information technology. They will learn and assist in various technology projects and programs such as assisting in the development of processes and procedures related to business continuity and disaster recovery of IT systems. Participating in various projects assisting teams in ensuring systems and infrastructure plan for and incorporate required resiliency to meet business needs for high availability. In this entry level role, the successful candidate will be exposed to various IT technologies and will develop skills related to system design, integration, support and operations.

Job Responsibilities

•As a Sr Technology Professional, this role is a natural growth progression for Technology Professionals who have gained 2 or more years of relevant technology experience. They will provide technical and/or business analysis in support of technology applications or infrastructure. Analyzes simple to moderately complex inquiries and determines appropriate technical area or vendor to resolve problems and makes suggestions for improvements. Responsible for executing smaller projects and/or support tasks and typically maintain a high level of direct client interaction. Works closely with management, clients, other systems technical staff and vendors in problem solving. Consults with the supervisor and IT professionals when the appropriate course of action is unclear or a major problem is suspected. They may be responsible for operating and maintaining production systems, as well as providing hardware/software equipment support. Provides technical support and guidance to client and systems areas through consulting, teaching and publication of documentation with a focus on business continuity and disaster recovery. Participates with client and development areas in the design and implementation of new or modified systems and infrastructure. Assists clients and other IT employees ensuring business continuity is considered and planned for as new are built or existing systems are modified or enhanced. Works with client and IT teams to coordinate, monitor, track and report on disaster recovery testing. Initiates and coordinates corrective actions. Performs related duties as assigned or requested.

Job Specific Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or STEM.
• Minimum 3.0 GPA
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Experience working with or related coursework in .NET, HTML, SQL, Java, Java scripting or Object Oriented Design.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management
• Experience designing and maintaining high availability systems or infrastructure including building and maintaining disaster recovery environments.
• Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc.
• Prior experience supporting a Windows environment
• Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks
Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

description:

Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 
SCHEDULE: 1.0 (40 hours per week), SHIFT: Days with rotating weekends.

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License

 

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
 

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Job Summary

IT's vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. Our Technology Operations Professional is similar to our Nuclear Operations Professional role except our Technology Operations Professional role is not solely focused on Nuclear's applications and field services support but to all Information Technology systems and applications in various locations in New Jersey and Long Island. This Technology Professional will not require a degreee in Computer Science or STEM field. Thus creating the opportunity to consider candidates with IT experience without a bachelor's degree. This position will lead to other advanced level Information Technology roles such as Associate Business Systems Analyst, Associate Technology Product Consultants through challenging assignments and allowing them to further develop their skills in various areas within Information Technology.

Job Responsibilities

•Responsible for working collaboratively with all stakeholders and serving as a technology leader for the effective use of technologies to maintain world-class operations and delivery of solutions. Identify future technologies and implement new technologies once business approved •Define and build technical and data architectures within PSEG integrated data platform(s). Develop governance that promote data standards. Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, source-to-target maps, and database policies and guidelines •Collaborate with the application developers and database administrators to ensure database performance, integrity and security •Provide other contributions as directed by your Technology Group Product Manager and/or Product Owner

Required
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or without a bachelor's degree, internship to 4 years of related IT experience

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand.
• Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
• Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques.
• Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware.
• Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect.
• Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements.
• Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area.
• Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment.
• Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results.
• Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as:
- Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift
- Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
- Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB
- Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio)
- Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
- Alexa skill development
• MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively.
• Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Ability to learn new business and technical concepts.
• Good written and oral communication skills.

Desired Skills :

Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Relevant certification is preferred such as Amazon Web Services (AWS)
• Experience with translating business requirements into system functional and non-functional requirements.
• Experience with business and system process flow techniques using UML (e.g. Use Case Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Entity Relationship Diagrams).
• Experience with specific phases of the software development life cycle, especially Agile, Iterative, and Waterfall.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

 Are you ready to help us make the future?

Join our newly formed Honeywell Robotics team and embark on an exciting journey to design novel Robots and Robotics Systems for deployment in Warehouse and Logistics sectors around the world. In this role you will architect, design, develop, integrate and test Industrial Robots in an Agile fashion. Our goal is to build and deploy plug-and-go robotic systems in Warehouse or Distribution Center environments. We also want you to help enable our sales and marketing teams to quickly assess customer opportunities and recommend realistic and workable Honeywell solutions both at the Robot and System level using prototypes to demonstrate clear business value.

To accomplish this objective, you will be integrating components from open source, universities, and partners into commercial robotic systems. This may require integrating sensors and sensor fusion, mechatronics, individual work items, environment, embedded digital control and Machine Learning Algorithms as well as the entire workflow interfacing to Honeywell’s Momentum or select third party Warehouse Execution Systems (WES). You will also collaborate with senior engineers to help develop the testing of Cloud Robotics technologies.

  • Software architecture and coding
  • Integration
  • Certification

  • Analytical skills & software development skills

  • Must be able to participate in a co-op prior to completing current degree program

WE VALUE

  • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration
  • Effective communicator
  • Wide degree of creativity and latitude
  • Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events.
  • Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness.
  • Can quickly analyze, incorporate and apply new information and concepts.
  • Industrial robotics experience such as Fanuc, Motoman/Yaskawa, ABB, Kuka etc.
  • Experience developing in C, C++ and Python.
  • Experience with Linux: Ubuntu

position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. position: Senior Research Engineer, Process Technology Development
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA   


 


Summary:


 


Reporting to the Sr. Manager in the Process Technology Development R&D, the Sr. Research Engineer will be responsible for the process development research related to the Better-For-You initiative and Sugar reduction from benchtop to pilot plant to commercialization. 


 


In addition to working with R&D team members, considerable interaction is expected with Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality, and other Supply Chain departments. The Senior Research Scientist will manage relationships internally and externally with business partners, suppliers, research institutes, universities, and other service providers to deliver required research results. The Senior Research Engineer assumes a leadership role in complex projects and guides them through Hershey Innovation process with a cross-functional team. He or she will participate in project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.


 


This individual will take the initiative to secure, from all available sources, pertinent advice, ideas, and information having a bearing upon the project. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required. Experience in leading a cross-functional technology and/or product development project to commercialization is desired. Presentation of the project results will be expected in both written and oral forms.


 


Responsibilities:


 


Project Leadership for Technology Development - Lead (60%) Assist (5%) Supervise (5%)



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities

  • Lead chocolate process technology development workstreams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which will focus on BFY chocolate process development

  • Champion assigned projects through Hershey Innovation process by owning process specifications that deliver quality product at commercialization

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations

  • Bring technical rigor to troubleshoot technical issues

  • Determine next steps through problem solving

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the performance of tests or experiments. Lead the development of new processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results. Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.  


 


Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation 



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data, and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.


 


Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:


 



  • Sound technical knowledge capable of applying knowledge to research project

  • Excellent communication, written and critical thinking skills

  • Lead process development, operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment

  • Strong project management and organizational skills

  • Demonstrated success in leading multiple and simultaneous projects.

  • Possess strong computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)

  • Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities

  • Strong mathematical skills

  • Experience in leading a cross-functional research and/or product development project.


 


Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 


 



  • B.S. degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required

  • 7+ years (with B.S. food/engineering degree) or 5+ years (with M.S.) in R&D environment in process development, process validation, and/or food engineering

  • Intern and prior research project work will be considered

  • Confectionary experience in chocolate and sweets processing preferred

position: Staff Engineer, Process Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Engineer uses process engineering and food science principles to lead process development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be leadership of chocolate process development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff engineer is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners. The successful candidate will report to the group’s Principal Engineer. 


 


Summary of major duties:



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 

  • Lead chocolate process technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY chocolate process development.

  • Lead complex process development and process validation to support product commercialization in various areas for the Hershey Company.

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.

  • Determine next steps through problem solving. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies.

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 

  • Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the

  • performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 

  • processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results.

  • Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.   



Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•    Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new process and/or technologies. 
•    Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•    Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•    Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•    Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•    Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•    Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•    Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•    Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 
Education: BS degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required.
Experience: 5-10+ years (B.S. food/engineering degree) or 3-5+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment  in process development, process validation, food engineering.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered. 
Experience in chocolate processing is a plus.

Position Overview:
Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting one of our key corporate initiatives. As an intern, you will work in a team environment delivering a working technical solution that can be leveraged for use by various existing customers and other government agencies.

Program Summary:
Work will consist of a wide range of project tasks to include web application design and development, database scripting, code reviews, technical documentation, and research into existing and emerging technologies. Interns will learn how to analyze both a living and pre-existing (legacy) codebase to re-engineer and improve upon both user-facing and back-end features.  NIS teams build more modern, scalable solutions that use open source and cloud-based architectures to provide improved user experience, security, reliability, and cost effectiveness. Interns will review and contribute to detailed technical requirements and documentation, learn and adopt DevOps best practices, contribute to prototypes and test plans, design new features, gather user feedback, research and present options to users and developers, analyze alternatives from a complexity and business cost to value basis, and write code to demo or present to existing and potential customers. NIS will gain from the intern's research and insights into the latest coding and design practices, while providing interns with an opportunity to build new skills and apply them to a key corporate initiative.

Additional Internship Information:
This is an eight-week paid internship program. We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the eight weeks and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared towards technical college students that are actively enrolled at an accredited university.

Our internship program is designed to provide college students the opportunity to learn about Nationwide IT Services and gain meaningful, hands-on work experience in a professional environment. We place an emphasis on developing the next generation's workforce. As part of our internship curriculum, we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various stakeholders within the company. This includes the chance to complete technical training courses, attend brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team and participate in teambuilding activities with mentors and fellow interns.

Job Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited university
  • Must be a US citizen
  • Must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment, and establish and maintain interpersonal relationships
  • Ability and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areas
  • Must possess strong decision-making skills, and the ability to organize and prioritize work
  • Must possess the ability to quickly ramp up on technical details of a project
  • Must take initiative to provide creative alternatives / solutions to intractable challenges or systemic problems
Nationwide IT Services, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status.

Company Description

Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).

Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA.  Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN.  We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees.  We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

Job Description

The Stratas Finance Team has an exciting opportunity for a talented Information Computer Science intern to help build small scale applications.   As an intern with Stratas Foods, you will not only work with and learn from industry professionals, but you will also share in the culture of teamwork at Stratas Foods.  

As an intern, key responsibilities will include the following:

  1. Conduct needs analysis
  2. Build small scale applications for the finance department based on business needs
  3. Work with the IT Department and Master Data Governance Team
Qualifications

  • An individual who has at least 1-2 years of undergraduate studies remaining
  • A concentration in Information Technology or related field
  • Application development background through any of the RAD (Rapid Application Development) softwares
  • Strong communication skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Macros
  • Proficient in SQL – Nice to have
  • Proficient in PowerBI – Nice to have
  • Critical Thinker


Additional Information

Competencies:

Communications – Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills in dealing with those both internal and external to Stratas are critical to success

Leadership - Ability to lead others in the directions necessary to achieve mutually beneficial goals is important

Analytical Skills – Having both the ability and competency to evaluate a variety of alternatives and pick the best solution in a dynamic work environment

Root cause problem-solving techniques:  Critical to a line manufacturing process

Developing teamwork and productivity:  Being proactive in employee relations efforts serves all well

Description & Requirements


PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients. Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.


The Intelligent Systems Lab at PARC has need for an intern with experience in formal methods, satisfiability and Satisfiability Modulo Theory (SMT). The area has multiple ongoing projects that contain combinatorial optimization components. The internship will match the intern with the project that best matches their abilities. A successful internship will result in papers at major AI conferences and patent applications.

+ Currently pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Information and Data Science, or related fields.

+ Successfully completed beginning-graduate coursework in AI.

+ Proven record of scientific investigation as demonstrated by project reports, conference presentations, publications (e.g., AAAI, IJCAI)

+ Experience in programming in Python or LISP and in software engineering.

+ Experience in empirical evaluation for complex intelligent agents.

+ Experience with combinatorial optimization, satisfiability, machine learning or algorithmics.

We are a pioneering autonomous building systems startup company. We are building a groundbreaking autonomous control platform for high-performance buildings and the future of smart cities. 

We have a position for a computer science intern that offers the opportunity to be a meaningful part of a team, develop production code, build test infrastructure, construct IT solutions, and solve real-world engineering problems.

This is an internship position (or entry-level), with the potential of a full-time position for the right candidate. Opportunity for involvement is limited only by your enthusiasm.

  • Developing a client-side application software
  • Building test infrastructure 
  • Database development for cloud and test support
  • Building machine learning back-end
  • Developing data visualization interfaces
  • IT infrastructure management 

You must have:

  • Strong research and problem solving skills
  • Experience with MacOS
  • Networking and system administration knowledge and experience
  • Strong programming skills (e.g. Javascript, Swift, Typescript, etc)
  • Must be able to both work in a team and have the ability to self manage on your own

  • Experience with relational databases, PostgreSQL
  • Experience with repositories, and content management
  • Experience with HTML and CSS
  • Experience with MVC design patterns

  • Medical, dental, vision (full time
  • Free drinks, snacks, and catered lunches

  • Must be diligent and get work done, but we do respect powder days

To apply for this position:

You must have or near completing a B.S. or better. Unless you have significant experience, a coding bootcamp isn't sufficient computer science background for this position. With your introduction and resume, include a description of a project (of any type) you personally created, devised, built, managed, organized, or designed that was of your own self-initiative. Also include any portfolio work, links to your code repo, personal website, etc.

About PassiveLogic

PassiveLogic builds the world's first autonomous platform for buildings. We make an infinitely configurable platform that enables users to design their own custom autonomous systems. We've reinvented the fundamental principals of automation to replace todays antiquated control logic.Our focus is democratizing automation for the average person, have an unmatched impact of energy savings, while ensuring buildings and smart cities are accessible, self-optimizing and human-centric.

Computer Science Intern - WD30114599112

 

What you will do 

Under general supervision, the qualified candidate evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering and technology principles and techniques to assigned business problems. The candidate will work in a distributed team environment on projects that have low to moderate impact on the business.  The candidate ensures that results meet established needs, goals, and timelines.

The qualified candidate for this position will work with a team of product management, business analysts and software developers on sales tools (selection and rating software) for YORK chiller products.  The candidate will be responsible for scope development, coordination, testing and reporting progress on their work to support migration to a new software platform. 

The job starts remote (because the office is closed), but will be an on-site when the office re-opens. Specific duties include: 

How you will do it

  • Designs, develops, documents, and tests software solutions in accordance with project specifications, ensuring completion within the planned time constraint and meeting the established objectives for quality, reliability and performance. Uses judgment in suggesting adaptations or modifications where appropriate. 
  • Researches technical and competitive information on product lines.
  • Develops, documents and executes test plans and sequences for software quality assurance.
  • Manage small projects and tasks with the support of the business team. Intern will be exposed to various aspects of the equipment business and team members, and present on at least one specific assignment to management.
  • Analyzes the impact and feasibility of change requests on existing software and implements corrective actions.
  • Provides both technical and administrative documentation in a timely manner for developed software and design models.
  • Adheres to the Company’s Code of Conduct and Business Ethics standards.

Qualifications

 

What we look for
Required Qualification:

  • A junior or senior level student in a Bachelor Degree program in Computer Science; or a senior level student in a Bachelor Degree program in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics discipline with strong Computer Science skills. 
  • The candidate willusually have limited (less than oneto twoyears)software development experience inC#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScriptor related high-level languages.
  • Some experience in relational database management systems and SQL.
  • Proficiency withMicrosoftWindows operating systemsandMS Office Suite programs.
  • Ability to manipulate large data collections in both databases and spreadsheets.
  • Ability to understand technical material.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with engineers, analysts, marketing personnel, designers, and drawing and software developers.
  • Ability to work independentlywith good organizational skills and the flexibility and adaptability to work on multiple projectswith exceptional attention to detail.
  • High degree of interpersonal skills including both oral and written communication.
  • Ability to assimilate and implement new and emerging technologies.
  • Customer-Focused: You start with the customer and work backwards. You invest the time and energy to understand your customers’ objectives, and then tie all your activities directly to the achievement of those objectives.
  • An Effective Communicator: You write and speak clearly and concisely. You actively inform and inspire with your messaging. You speak plainly and are transparent with your business colleagues.
  • Tech-Savvy: You have the ability to learn and use new software tools and programs
  • Action-Oriented: You thrive as a self-starter who proactively senses and responds to problems and opportunities.
  • Innately Curious: Asking questions is how you learn. You thrive on interaction with experienced professionals and seek to incorporate over-arching strategies into the task at hand.
  • Results-Driven: You are awesome at setting your own daily priorities and delivering projects on time that match requirements and expectations.
  • Collaborative: You love teamwork. Your colleagues love having you on the team. You have a sense of humor and are comfortable collaborating across sales, product, account management, engineering and marketing to deliver results.
  • Detail-Focused: You can manage multiple projects simultaneously, in a matrixed organization, with attention to detail, tenacity, and a focus on results.
  • Analytical: Proven analytical skills and the ability to effectively organize marketing data.

At UL, we know why we come to work.

Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

UL’s renewables wind advisory team is seeking a college-level engineering or computer science student to join our wind advisory team. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. This is a great opportunity to learn from an experienced team of Food Safety & Quality professionals. The Technical Services Support Intern will be an active part of the team that helps create and manage systems to streamline both the department and T/S supported teams. Location: Hershey, PA

Duration: Summer 2021

WHY HERSHEY? 

The Hershey Company is a global fortune 500 company that is a recognized leader in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry. Our goal is to integrate students with our knowledgeable and successful teams in order to maintain a fresh perspective on an ever-changing world. Every day presents new challenges and opportunities to learn, grow and innovate. Are you up for the challenge? Are you ready to make a difference?

 

WHY INFORMATION SERVICES AT HERSHEY? 

The Information Services department at The Hershey Company has open internships for analytically minded, tech-savvy undergraduate and graduate students. Technology and analytics are elemental to all aspects of Hershey business. Hershey has a diverse global team focused on providing robust innovative capabilities, partnering on analysis to drive successful business outcomes and embraces an entrepreneurial mindset to create an environment that is exciting, compelling, innovative and dynamic.

 

OPPORTUNITIES:

We are looking for a Data Science Internwho will work with the Enterprise Data Science to build strong analytic capabilities.  Applicants must have some exposure to at least two of the following: machine learning, statistical modeling, feature engineering, optimization, exploratory data analysis, data mining and pattern recognition.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Use machine learning, and advanced statistical techniques to create scalable solutions to business problems
  • Collaborate with the Enterprise Data Science team to define and quantify business problems, and help them implement appropriate algorithmic solutions
  • Proactively identify capabilities which should be improved
  • Partner with Information Services and business stakeholders to drive conversion

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Experience machine learning tools (e.g., Scikit-learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Pandas, NumPy)
  • Experience with Python, R and Jupyter
  • Passion for analytical problem solving
  • Quick learner through formal and self-guided education
  • Pro-active self-starter with a desire to make an impact
  • Ability to work in teams or individually
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
  • Exposure to analytical solutions in the cloud (e.g., Azure, AWS, or GCP) a plus

 

EDUCATION:

  • GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree with quantitative, STEM focus (e.g. Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Psychology - other degrees will be considered). Graduate degrees with an analytical focus considered too.

position: Intern - I&C Engineering - KK - LYH - May 2021
description:
Looking for an exciting opportunity in the nuclear industry? Grow your career at Framatome!

Framatome is a major international player in the nuclear energy market recognized for its innovative solutions and value-added technologies for designing, building, maintaining, and advancing the global nuclear fleet. The company designs, manufactures, and installs components and fuel for nuclear power plants and offers a full range of reactor services.

With 14,000 employees worldwide, every day Framatome’s expertise helps its customers improve the safety and performance of their nuclear plants and achieve their economic and societal goals.

Join the energy conversation with Framatome Inc. on Twitter: @FramatomeUS and Facebook: @FramatomeUS.

Framatome is owned by the EDF Group (75.5%), Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI 19.5%) and Assystem (5%).

JOB DESCRIPTION

Framatome is seeking an Engineering Intern to support our I&C Electrical and Instrumentation organization.

This qualified individual will:

In a team-based environment, support Engineers who design digital and analog control systems for nuclear power plants. Working alongside more senior engineers, will assist in defining system requirements, developing system logic and defining control parameters to satisfy requirements.

You will also assist in performing system integration of hardware and software platforms, as well as prepare documentation such as requirements, test procedures, and instruction manuals. You will assist senior design engineers during installation and start-up of delivered I&C systems and with hardware design for integration with software (system integration with some board level design).



Required Skills


Required Experience

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity.

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering/Engineering Technology, Computer Science or Physics, with at least four semesters completed by start of internship/co-op.
    • Please attach a copy of your unofficial academic transcript as part of your application. Transcripts can be added in the Profile Attachments section (Step 5) of the online application.
  • Strong academic performance
  • Strong math and computer programming coursework/experience
  • Strong technical problem-solving abilities
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to use typical laboratory equipment such as Signal Generators, Oscilloscopes, DVMs, Power Supplies, and logic analyzers
  • Completed curriculum or labs in analog and digital electronics design (for those seeking a Hardware-oriented internship)
  • Lab experience involving software and hardware integration

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

  • Previous internship/co-op experience in field of study

  • Lab experience in embedded system design and programming

  • Lab experience with 2D CAD or 3D modeling software (i.e., AutoCAD, Solidworks)

  • Coursework or other experience with a high level programming language such as C++, C#, Java, Visual Basic, or LabView

  • Skills in analog & digital electronics design

  • PCB layout (Eagle)

  • PLC programming      

This opportunity is in Lynchburg, Virginia

After work you will enjoy all that Central Virginia has to offer. From beautiful Smith Mountain Lake to the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains you can hike, mountain bike, snowboard and water ski to your hearts content. You'll avoid the traffic hassles of a major city, while being in driving distance to many of the major cities, beaches and attractions along the mid-Atlantic coast. Take in a minor league baseball game or one of the many festivals in the region. Our Young Generation Nuclear group hosts numerous social and professional development events that will allow you to quickly build relationships and advance your career.

Framatome is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

NCTCOG is a voluntary association of, by and for local governments, and was established to assist local governments in planning for common needs, cooperating for mutual benefit, and coordinating for sound regional development. NCTCOG's purpose is to strengthen both the individual and collective power of local governments and to help them recognize regional opportunities, eliminate unnecessary duplication, and make joint decisions. Since 1974, NCTCOG has served as the Metropolitan Planning Organization for transportation in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metropolitan Area and is responsible for developing transportation plans and programs that address the complex needs of the rapidly growing area. The planning area for transportation includes the 12 counties of Collin, Dallas, Denton, Ellis, Hood, Hunt, Johnson, Kaufman, Parker, Rockwall, Tarrant, and Wise.

The agency offers generous benefits, a friendly atmosphere with open communications for cooperative decision making, and challenging opportunities. The environment encourages both individual and team growth, responsibility, and innovation.

NCTCOG is recognized as a military-friendly employer and values the knowledge, experience, and skills acquired during your military service career. All qualified veterans are invited to apply.

Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities. All candidates must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screen and national criminal background check in order to receive an employment offer from NCTCOG.

position: Software Engineer - Full Stack Web - Intern
description:
We are a stealth startup building perception systems for autonomy. We are based in the San Francisco Bay Area, funded by NEA, and our core team includes faculty entrepreneurs (Stanford and UC Santa Barbara) and industry veterans (Uber, Apple, Amazon Lab126, Rohde & Schwarz), who have successfully shepherded signal processing and machine learning innovations to large-scale software for location improvement and safety at Uber, led the development of state-of-the-art computer vision technologies that shipped over millions of Amazon devices, and delivered zero-to-one product experiences at Uber and Box. Our core product grew out of 5+ years of university R&D by our co-founders. You can find out more about us by visiting our website.

Our mission and team expertise spans beyond software to advanced sensor systems, algorithms, embedded systems, signal processing, and machine learning. Our team is building and deploying edge software and cloud services for real-time customer facing products as well as internal big data tools. We look for people with a depth of expertise and experience in one of these areas, and with the intellectual curiosity for interacting with, learning from, and teaching world-class experts in areas outside their expertise.

We currently have an exciting paid internship opportunity for full stack web application development in San Carlos, CA. You will join a multi-disciplinary group of scientists and engineers and will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional product and research teams. An ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving zero-to-one innovation for large-scale system projects.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure scalability, availability and data security for your services.
  • Own, troubleshoot & resolve code defects.
  • Implement best practices for software development and documentation, and making sure designs meet requirements.
  • Implement test driven unit and end to end testing of any code you develop.
  • Prepare technical requirements and software design specifications.
  • Deliver high quality work under tight deadlines.

Required Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 3+ months experience working on production software.
  • Experience building production type software, leveraging basic OO design/development skills, and practicing solid documentation methods.
  • Experience with at least one modern web programming languages. (Golang, Node/JavaScript, and Python).
  • Experience with at least one modern web application frontend and backend frameworks (Vue.js, ReactJS, Go net/http, gRPC, Express.JS, ...). 
  • Experienced with open-source technologies (including GNU/Linux, Bash/Zsh, Protocol Buffers).
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services, e.g., S3, SQS, EC2, RDS, CloudFormation, Redshift or equivalent experience in Google Cloud, Azure or other.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 1+ years experience working on production software.
  • Experience with a client-server application model. Experience working with microservice architecture environments is a plus.
  • Experience developing production web applications, preferably at a large-scale in high-traffic environments. Experience with full-stack production-grade web frameworks and tools are a plus, for example Node.js, React (and JSX), Webpack, SASS/Less.
  • Experience successfully planning, organizing, and conducting software development projects in a dynamic environment. Experience with code review and task management processes are a plus.
  • Hands-on experience with modern infrastructure technologies, such as Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Vault, Packer, Spinnaker, Istio, and Envoy.
  • Experience interacting with and managing databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Cassandra, ...) and/or key-value stores. (e.g. Redis, memcached, …)
  • Experience developing cloud software services and understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.
  • Experience defining, developing and maintaining web service API's.
  • Experience supporting machine learning applications and data scientists.
  • Ability to define system architecture and explore the feasibility of various designs.
  • Experience with Big Data technologies, e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Hive, Kafka ...
  • Likes California

Software Engineer Intern

 

Why YOU want this position

Since our founding as a groundbreaking provider of oil & gas data, we have evolved our solutions to cover oil & gas analytics, trading & risk, and business automationfor customers across the energy industry. Enverus represents this growth while bringing us closer together as one team. Enverus delivers business-critical insights to the global energy industry through a state-of-the-art SaaS platform built on industry-leading data and energy analytics. Our solutions deliver value across the entire energy value chain, empowering customers to be more agile, efficient, and competitive. The range of energy industry participants we serve includes exploration and production (E&P) companies and related businesses such as oilfield services, midstream, capital markets, power generators and utilities, energy traders, and downstream commercial & industrial energy consumers.

As part of the emphasis on growing our presence in the power industry, we are currently seeking a highly engaged and eager to learn Software Engineer Intern to join our Development team. This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in the world’s most dynamic and fastest-growing sector. Enverus is the right company at the right time.

 

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be responsible for assisting the development efforts on SaaS softwareand machine learning services for the Enverus PRT product suite.

  • You enjoy learning and can take constructive comments from others as you have opportunities to learn

  • You like to work with cutting edge technologies
